The use of all caps: alternating text background colors, and excessive question marks in the email subject line, which are indicators of unreliable information.
The circulation of similar chain emails: S. Department of Homeland Security seizing safe deposit box contents since 2006, suggesting a lack of credibility.
The lack of specific evidence or verifia: such as the actual text of the alleged written communication from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.
The expert: s consultation with David McGuinn, president of Safe Deposit Specialists, who debunked the claim and attributed its resurgence to the Cyprus financial crisis, indicating that the claim may have originated from a different context and is not applicable to the United States.
